entries.title: Brazil’s Lula fires army chief in wake of pro-Bolsonaro riots
entries.description: The dismissal of Julio Cesar de Arruda comes shortly after Lula removed dozens of soldiers from his security detail.

entries.title: The West’s ‘indecision’ is killing our people, Ukraine says
entries.description: Germany has been under growing pressure to provide Leopard tanks to Kyiv but says it has yet to make a decision.

entries.title: What’s stopping German-made Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine?
entries.description: Ukraine has urged Germany to provide the stealth tanks but NATO has failed to agree amid Russian threats.

entries.title: Peru closes Machu Picchu site as anti-govt protests continue
entries.description: European Union decries 'disproportionate' police response to the deadly unrest as protester death toll rises to 45.

entries.title: Why are so many jobs being shed in Big Tech?
entries.description: Hundreds of thousands of people laid off in just over a year as major tech firms cut back.

entries.title: India asks YouTube, Twitter to block links of BBC film on Modi
entries.description: The documentary critical of PM Modi's role in the deadly 2002 Gujarat riots draws the ire of Indian government.

entries.title: Canada says it will repatriate 23 of its citizens from Syria
entries.description: Move comes after the citizens, currently detained in camps for ISIL family members in Syria, challenged Ottawa in court.

entries.title: UN envoy says ‘progress’ made on Afghan women’s rights
entries.description: Amina Mohammed, who held talks with the Taliban tells Al Jazeera some progress made but much remains to be done.

entries.title: Jacinda Ardern, the public servant
entries.description: The resignation of New Zealand's prime minister shows humility and empathy still have a place in politics.

entries.title: Turkey cancels Swedish minister visit over right-wing protest
entries.description: Turkey has been angered by Sweden’s green light for a protest in front of its embassy in Stockholm.

entries.title: Palestinian man shot dead in occupied West Bank
entries.description: The Palestinian Ministry of Health said on Saturday that 42-year-old Tariq Maali was shot in the city of Ramallah.

entries.title: Iran condemns EU vote over ‘terrorist’ designation for IRGC
entries.description: Response from Tehran on Thursday's move has ranged from defiance to warnings of consequences for Europe.

entries.title: The Twitter Files: The deep state connection
entries.description: Twitter's secret relationship with the US government. Plus, SLAPPs - the tool used to silence critical journalism.

entries.title: Dozens injured as deadly protests continue in Peru
entries.description: Police officers use tear gas on protesters as demonstrations continue after the removal of President Castillo.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 332
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 332nd day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Indian wrestlers end protest over sexual harassment
entries.description: Wrestlers and supporters were accusing federation president of sexually and mentally harassing young female athletes.

entries.title: Is globalisation breaking down or transforming?
entries.description: Crisis upon crisis threatens to fracture the global economy after decades of economic integration.

entries.title: Kidnapped women and children freed in Burkina Faso
entries.description: Armed men had abducted 66 people on January 12 and 13 outside two villages in the district of Arbinda.

entries.title: Italian football club Juventus hit with points penalty
entries.description: Record 36-time Italian champions will fall from third into 10th and could miss out on European football's next season.

entries.title: Kremlin stays silent on missile systems seen on Moscow rooftops
entries.description: Images on social media appear to show Pantsir-S1 mobile anti-aircraft systems installed in locations around Moscow.

entries.title: Chris Hipkins set to replace Jacinda Ardern as New Zealand’s PM
entries.description: Currently minister for police, education and public service, Hipkins, 44, has been described as 'sensible' and 'tough'.

entries.title: US designates Russian Wagner mercenary force a crime organisation
entries.description: The Wagner Group has an estimated 50,000 fighters in Ukraine, 80 percent of them drawn from Russian prisons.

entries.title: Is bias, not science, behind COVID-19 curbs on China travellers?
entries.description: Experts say restrictions on China 'very unlikely' to help fight the virus and could lead to discriminatory behaviour.

entries.title: Lunar New Year dilemma for China’s post ‘zero-COVID’ travellers
entries.description: Despite removal of COVID travel restrictions, many have grappled with whether to visit vulnerable loved ones.

entries.title: Family of man killed in police incident files $50m claim
entries.description: Los Angeles police had repeatedly Tasered the cousin of a Black Lives Matter co-founder in the hours before his death.

entries.title: Brazilian defence minister: Military had no direct role in riots
entries.description: Brazil's President Lula has suggested the pro-Bolsonaro rioters acted with help from inside the government.
